irena-bg-inv-all.def: Bioenergy use falls into two main categories: ‚Äútraditional‚Äù and ‚Äúmodern‚Äù. Traditional use refers to the combustion of biomass in such forms as wood, animal waste and traditional charcoal. Modern bioenergy technologies include liquid biofuels produced from bagasse and other plants; bio-refineries; biogas produced through anaerobic digestion of residues; wood pellet heating systems; and other technologies.
irena-bg-inv-all.name: Biogas (All)
